<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/05/more-resignations-as-the-nwsl-scandal-snowballs?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The NWSL Is Rotten
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/05/more-resignations-as-the-nwsl-scandal-snowballs?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Soccer ball for the NWSL" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/262c687ab52bf485c3906023e6f28acf58e71958-1024x682.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Randy Litzinger/Icon Sportswire via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Steve Baldwin, the controlling owner and CEO of the Washington Spirit women’s soccer team, <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2021/10/05/steven-baldwin-washington-spirit-nwsl-resigns/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">resigned</a> yesterday as a sexual harassment scandal deepened across the National Women’s Soccer League (NWSL), the top women’s pro soccer league in the US.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Baldwin was facing pressure to step down after Spirit coach Richie Burke was fired when a <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2021/09/22/washington-spirit-workplace-women-nwsl/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Washington Post report</a> revealed he verbally and emotionally abused players.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And he was the second NWSL coach to get fired last week. The North Carolina Courage sacked Paul Riley following a report by The Athletic, which spoke to more than a dozen athletes who played under Riley and accused him of sexual coercion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last Friday, the league’s commissioner, Lisa Baird, resigned and multiple games were canceled over the weekend.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">On the surface, the NWSL had never been more successful</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It was the first US pro sports league to return from a pandemic hiatus in June 2020, and it found a much bigger audience: Viewership <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/13/womens-soccer-viewership-records-paving-expansion.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged nearly</a> 300% last season thanks to partnerships with CBS Sports and Twitch.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At the same time, the NWSL <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2021/02/23/serena-williams-natalie-portman-nwsl-investors/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went Hollywood</a>. An expansion team based in Los Angeles, Angel City FC, is owned by A-listers including Serena Williams, Natalie Portman, and Mia Hamm. Tennis star Naomi Osaka bought a stake in the NWSL team North Carolina Courage. The league locked in sponsorship deals with Verizon, Procter & Gamble, and Google.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Players had a different experience. On the <em>Today </em>show yesterday, women’s soccer legend Alex Morgan criticized the NWSL’s (lack of) response to sexual harassment complaints, calling it a “<a href="https://www.espn.com/soccer/united-states-nwsl/story/4491798/nwsl-scandal-amid-riley-sacking-uswnts-morgan-says-sexual-harassment-is-league-wide-problem?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">systemic failure</a>.” And the players are still negotiating for fair pay—the league’s basic structure pays players $22,000–$52,500 this season. They’ve said their financially precarious situation has made it more challenging to speak out against abuse, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/washington-spirit-ceo-resigns-in-widening-soccer-scandal-11633457525?mod=hp_lead_pos13" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the WSJ wrote</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>NWSL plans to resume games today, but under a storm of investigations from the likes of FIFA and the US Soccer Federation.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/05/whistleblower-testifies-that-facebook-knowingly-harms-teens?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Frances Haugen Goes Face to Facebook
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/05/whistleblower-testifies-that-facebook-knowingly-harms-teens?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Frances Haugen testifies in court" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/c161a4e202910cc3e5d3f03f06ba4e7ad7ffeea2-1190x772.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jabin Botsford-Pool/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After leaking a <em>Song of Ice and Fire</em>-sized tome of internal documents to the Wall Street Journal and the SEC, former Facebook product manager Frances Haugen <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/10/05/technology/facebook-whistleblower-frances-haugen?name=styln-facebook&region=hub&block=storyline_live_updates_block_recirc&action=click&pgtype=LegacyCollection#what-happened-at-facebook-whistleblower-hearing" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">challenged</a> the platform’s Silicon Throne in Senate testimony yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Problem: </strong>According to Haugen, Facebook knowingly harms teens via its algorithm’s curation. She <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/05/congress-demands-mark-zuckerberg-answer-questions-at-haugen-hearing.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">placed the blame</a> for that squarely on CEO Mark Zuckerberg: “Mark has built an organization that is very metrics-driven. ...The metrics make the decision. Unfortunately that itself is a decision,” she said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Solution: </strong>Haugen wants Facebook to start by sharing more internal data with outsiders. “As long as Facebook is operating in the shadows and hiding its research from public scrutiny, it is unaccountable,” she said. As it stands, ”Almost no one outside of Facebook knows what is happening inside.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Haugen also suggested legislators rework Section 230—an infamous snippet of the Communications Decency Act that protects platforms from being legally liable for what their users post.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Facebook’s response? </strong>In a <a href="https://twitter.com/andymstone/status/1445445524350513155?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">statement</a>, Facebook a) said that it disagreed with Haugen’s characterization of the topics she testified about and b) attempted to discredit Haugen for not working with those topics directly during her <2 years at the company.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Haugen's testimony may turn up the volume on calls to regulate the social media giant, which is still recovering from its 6-hour outage Monday.—<em>JW</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CULTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/05/survey-says-teens-are-cheugy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Survey Says: Teens are Cheugy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Good news for anyone with a teen in their life: We’ve got some conversation material to switch things up from Billie Eilish and <a href="https://mashable.com/article/tiktok-berries-and-cream-deeptok?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Berries and Cream TikTok</a>. The fall teen survey from investment bank Piper Sandler just <a href="https://piper2.bluematrix.com/docs/pdf/3bad99c6-e44a-4424-8fb1-0e3adfcbd1d4.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped</a>, revealing the attitudes and buying habits of 10,000 US teens.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tech:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>iPhone ownership is at 87%.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Snapchat is the top social network (35% share), followed by TikTok (30%).</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>22% of teens have heard of NFTs, and 10% of those who’ve heard of them have purchased one.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Entertainment and fashion:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nike is the top teen brand, holding its spot for the eleventh straight year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Adam Sandler is their favorite celebrity (</span><span><em>Hubie Halloween</em></span><span> season is upon us, after all), followed by Ryan Reynolds.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Crocs are on the rise. They’re teens’ sixth-most preferred footwear brand, up from ninth place last year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Politics:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>54% of teens consider their carbon footprint when making a purchase.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The most important social/political issue to them is the environment, followed by racial equality.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re a citizen of the internet, you might have seen the prices of certain digital coins soar past certain eye-popping numbers and wondered...should I dip a toe in that pond? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Crypto FOMO is a very real affliction these days, so we cooked up a treatment: <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/507632789;309281180;o" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Episode 4 </a>of Season 2 of Fresh Invest, our podcast with Fidelity.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the episode, the reigning monarch of this newsletter, Morning Brew Executive Chairman Alex Lieberman, chats with Fidelity Director of Global Macro Jurrien Timmer about how to approach crypto investing. You are not actually legally required to do anything to your Twitter avatar—common misconception. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s only natural to want to get in on what sometimes seems like a gold rush, but you may not want to convert your retirement fund to the latest altcoin out of FOMO before doing some research. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Instead, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/507632789;309281180;o" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">learn about crypto investing from the latest episode of Fresh Invest</a>.</p>

<img alt="Empty streets of the city are seen on July 27, 2020 in Melbourne, Australia" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/ef53720a2f2ab041676adb0346434864415a7ded-1024x713.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Quinn Rooney/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Melbourne, Australia’s second-largest city, has been <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2021/oct/02/how-melbournes-short-sharp-covid-lockdowns-became-the-longest-in-the-world?utm_source=Eurasia+Group+Signal&utm_campaign=b5f22ed3eb-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2021_10_05_11_06&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_e605619869-b5f22ed3eb-170107393" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in lockdown</a> for 247 days since March 2020, roughly 45% of the duration of the pandemic. It recently passed Buenos Aires as the city that’s spent the most time cumulatively under stay-at-home orders. This lockdown, the sixth, will lift once at least 80% of adults in the state of Victoria are fully vaccinated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I’m opposed to it and I don’t think we should consider it seriously. It’s really a gimmick.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/yellen-says-debt-ceiling-hike-utterly-essential-opposes-platinum-coin-gimmick-2021-10-05/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not on board</a> with the proposal to mint a $1 trillion platinum coin to bypass the debt ceiling crisis. She did say it was “utterly essential” for Congress to suspend the debt limit to avoid a recession.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Understanding how Facebook disappeared from the internet. (<a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/october-2021-facebook-outage/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cloudflare</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/05/russian-film-shot-in-space?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
But Can They Live up to the Legacy of 'Armageddon'?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/05/russian-film-shot-in-space?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A Russian actor and director inside a spacecraft simulator" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/6c0f2d70020b259ad1eab11ad7eb34997eecc612-1052x706.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mikhail Japaridze\TASS via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The first feature film shot in space is officially rolling, and somehow Tom Cruise wasn’t hiding in the glove compartment. A Russian film crew of two docked with the ISS on Tuesday, ahead of a 12-day shooting schedule aboard the space station.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Russian actress Yulia Peresild, director Klim Shipenko, and their guide, veteran cosmonaut Anton Shkaplerov, made their way into the ISS <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/05/entertainment/russian-film-crew-space-launch-scn/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">around 11am</a> ET Tuesday morning. They’ll be filming scenes for a Russian film called <em>Challenge</em>, about a surgeon who has to operate on a sick cosmonaut in space.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hollywood’s space race:</strong> The Russian film was announced in November 2020, putting it head-to-head at the time with a planned <a href="https://deadline.com/2020/07/tom-cruise-space-movie-pitch-200-million-budget-universal-pictures-doug-liman-elon-musk-christopher-mcquarrie-1202999849/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$200 million</a> Tom Cruise space film directed by Doug Liman (who directed Cruise in <em>Edge of Tomorrow</em>). The Cruise project, in partnership with SpaceX and NASA, was reportedly going to shoot aboard the ISS in <a href="https://deadline.com/2020/09/tom-cruise-doug-liman-space-x-film-nasa-launch-date-1234582558/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">October 2021</a>, though no official date was announced.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Still uncharted shooting territory for bold filmmakers:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In an active volcano</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Inside a live whale</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On the sun</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Word Search: </strong>Who doesn't love vintage postcards? See if you can identify the cities featured on postcards in <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/05/word-search-vintage-city-postcards?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">today's puzzle</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Correct the Timeline</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The following historical events happened on October 6. Can you put them in the correct chronological order?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Yom Kippur War begins.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Michael Jordan announces his (first) retirement from the NBA.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Jason Lewis becomes the first person to circumnavigate the globe using only human-powered modes of transportation.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>George Michael releases the song “Faith.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Yankees beat the Dodgers for their 11th World Series win.</span></li>
</ol>
</div>

<img alt="The Brew's College Athlete Ambassador program image" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/99378b0815c21db95344ee1ddcdad9e4a2dd0ade-1500x700.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Morning Brew was founded in a dorm at the University of Michigan, so college athletics have a special place in our hearts (Go Blue). That's why when the NCAA ruled that athletes could finally capitalize on their name, image, and likeness, launching our College Athlete Program was a no-brainer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We wanted to take a moment to shout out some of our amazing student-athletes, including:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Sae-Vheon Alcorn:</strong></span><span> University of Kansas, Track & Field, </span><span><a href="https://www.instagram.com/saevheon/?hl=en" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@saevheon</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Porter Wilson: </strong></span><span>Duke University, Football, </span><span><a href="https://www.instagram.com/porter_wilson/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@porter_wilson</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Christian Avila Neres: </strong></span><span>Franklin & Marshall College, Soccer, </span><span><a href="https://www.instagram.com/_chrisavilaa_/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@_chrisavilaa_</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Interested in being a Morning Brew Athlete? Apply <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1HEHYXpUbB47FixfOEZIdXUTs5znHpfVqqVZobRUn5P0/edit?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>
</div>

target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWashington Post report\u003c/a\u003e revealed he verbally and emotionally abused players.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd he was the second NWSL coach to get fired last week. The North Carolina Courage sacked Paul Riley following a report by The Athletic, which spoke to more than a dozen athletes who played under Riley and accused him of sexual coercion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast Friday, the league’s commissioner, Lisa Baird, resigned and multiple games were canceled over the weekend.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOn the surface, the NWSL had never been more successful\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt was the first US pro sports league to return from a pandemic hiatus in June 2020, and it found a much bigger audience: Viewership \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/13/womens-soccer-viewership-records-paving-expansion.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurged nearly\u003c/a\u003e 300% last season thanks to partnerships with CBS Sports and Twitch.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt the same time, the NWSL \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2021/02/23/serena-williams-natalie-portman-nwsl-investors/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewent Hollywood\u003c/a\u003e. An expansion team based in Los Angeles, Angel City FC, is owned by A-listers including Serena Williams, Natalie Portman, and Mia Hamm. Tennis star Naomi Osaka bought a stake in the NWSL team North Carolina Courage. The league locked in sponsorship deals with Verizon, Procter \u0026 Gamble, and Google.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlayers had a different experience. On the \u003cem\u003eToday \u003c/em\u003eshow yesterday, women’s soccer legend Alex Morgan criticized the NWSL’s (lack of) response to sexual harassment complaints, calling it a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/soccer/united-states-nwsl/story/4491798/nwsl-scandal-amid-riley-sacking-uswnts-morgan-says-sexual-harassment-is-league-wide-problem?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esystemic failure\u003c/a\u003e.” And the players are still negotiating for fair pay—the league’s basic structure pays players $22,000–$52,500 this season. They’ve said their financially precarious situation has made it more challenging to speak out against abuse, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/washington-spirit-ceo-resigns-in-widening-soccer-scandal-11633457525?mod=hp_lead_pos13\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe WSJ wrote\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eNWSL plans to resume games today, but under a storm of investigations from the likes of FIFA and the US Soccer Federation.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter leaking a \u003cem\u003eSong of Ice and Fire\u003c/em\u003e-sized tome of internal documents to the Wall Street Journal and the SEC, former Facebook product manager Frances Haugen \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/10/05/technology/facebook-whistleblower-frances-haugen?name=styln-facebook\u0026region=hub\u0026block=storyline_live_updates_block_recirc\u0026action=click\u0026pgtype=LegacyCollection#what-happened-at-facebook-whistleblower-hearing\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echallenged\u003c/a\u003e the platform’s Silicon Throne in Senate testimony yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eProblem: \u003c/strong\u003eAccording to Haugen, Facebook knowingly harms teens via its algorithm’s curation. She \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/05/congress-demands-mark-zuckerberg-answer-questions-at-haugen-hearing.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplaced the blame\u003c/a\u003e for that squarely on CEO Mark Zuckerberg: “Mark has built an organization that is very metrics-driven. ...The metrics make the decision. Unfortunately that itself is a decision,” she said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSolution: \u003c/strong\u003eHaugen wants Facebook to start by sharing more internal data with outsiders. “As long as Facebook is operating in the shadows and hiding its research from public scrutiny, it is unaccountable,” she said. As it stands, ”Almost no one outside of Facebook knows what is happening inside.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHaugen also suggested legislators rework Section 230—an infamous snippet of the Communications Decency Act that protects platforms from being legally liable for what their users post.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFacebook’s response? \u003c/strong\u003eIn a \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/andymstone/status/1445445524350513155?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estatement\u003c/a\u003e, Facebook a) said that it disagreed with Haugen’s characterization of the topics she testified about and b) attempted to discredit Haugen for not working with those topics directly during her \u003c2 years at the company.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eHaugen's testimony may turn up the volume on calls to regulate the social media giant, which is still recovering from its 6-hour outage Monday.—\u003cem\u003eJW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" A Russian film crew of two docked with the ISS on Tuesday, ahead of a 12-day shooting schedule aboard the space station.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRussian actress Yulia Peresild, director Klim Shipenko, and their guide, veteran cosmonaut Anton Shkaplerov, made their way into the ISS \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/05/entertainment/russian-film-crew-space-launch-scn/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earound 11am\u003c/a\u003e ET Tuesday morning. They’ll be filming scenes for a Russian film called \u003cem\u003eChallenge\u003c/em\u003e, about a surgeon who has to operate on a sick cosmonaut in space.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHollywood’s space race:\u003c/strong\u003e The Russian film was announced in November 2020, putting it head-to-head at the time with a planned \u003ca href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/07/tom-cruise-space-movie-pitch-200-million-budget-universal-pictures-doug-liman-elon-musk-christopher-mcquarrie-1202999849/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$200 million\u003c/a\u003e Tom Cruise space film directed by Doug Liman (who directed Cruise in \u003cem\u003eEdge of Tomorrow\u003c/em\u003e). The Cruise project, in partnership with SpaceX and NASA, was reportedly going to shoot aboard the ISS in \u003ca href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/09/tom-cruise-doug-liman-space-x-film-nasa-launch-date-1234582558/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eOctober 2021\u003c/a\u003e, though no official date was announced.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStill uncharted shooting territory for bold
